title: Justice, liberty and law: an introduction
brief_description: The American Bill of Rights provides a focal point for discussion of the ideal of justice. What is right and fair? Rights of the individual are raised for discussion. Individual rights to protest and the need to keep law and order are presented as conflicting interests. A number of people who hold opposing views are interviewed. Suitable for upper secondary level.
